tn.text: AT: "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you."
Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:03:13|3:13]].
Amos is speaking to those who "sell" and "market" (8:5).
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:02:07|2:7]].

tn.ref: They say, "When will the new moon be over, so we can sell grain again? When will the Sabbath day be over, so that we can sell wheat?"
tn.text: "They are always asking when the new moon will be over so they can sell grain again, and when the Sabbath will be over so they can market wheat." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: We will make the measure small and increase the price, as we cheat with false scales
tn.text: The merchants would use false scales that showed that the amount of grain they were giving was greater than it really was and that the weight of the payment was less than it really was.

tn.ref: the needy for a pair of sandals
tn.text: AT: "and buy the needy for a pair of sandals" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Yahweh has sworn by the pride of Jacob
tn.text: "Yahweh has sworn by himself, saying" or "Yahweh, of whom Jacob is so proud, has sworn"
another name for the Nile River
Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:03:13|3:13]].
Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:amo:03:13|3:13]].

tn.ref: They will stagger ... they will run
tn.text: Some will walk slowly and fall down easily, like a person who is starving, and others will here and there quickly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: from sea to sea; they will run from the north to the east to seek the word
tn.text: Possible meanings: 1) see UDB, or 2) "from sea to sea and from the north to the east. They will be running to seek the word."

tn.ref: from sea to sea ... from the north to the east
tn.text: For a person standing at Bethel, this could be a circle: Dead Sea (south) to the Mediterranean (west) to north to east. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: As the way to Beersheba exists
tn.text: This is probably a reference to the roads that pilgrims would take to Beersheba in order to worship idols there.
